intro: Geonoma mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sword fern, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, sword-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. Its rhizome is fibrous and helps anchor it to rocky or soil substrates. The leaves are usually leathery and have a distinctive, narrow lanceolate shape.
